name: Holiday Inn Seattle Airport

reviews.title: Grubby but convenient
reviews.text: Grubby airport hotel. The location is great, you can walk to the hotel from the airport which saves a lot of hassle with courtesy coaches. The rooms are a decent size and technically clean but they look grubby. Glad I only had a day rate room and didn't actually stay the night. The pool is cold, actually cold and there is no changing room or showers ?? I had to change round the corner by the jacuzzi which was over chlorinated and my eyes were burning. It's ok, but grubby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Just left and all was fine

reviews.text: Distance from airport close but take the shuttle
reviews.title: Basic airport hotel

reviews.text: Every staff member we had any contact with, from the desk people, door people, cleaners, etc.
reviews.title: Such a lovely staff, such a run down hotel

reviews.text: were without fail, polite, friendly and helpful. But...... the hotel, built in the 80's probably hasn't been remodeled since then. The bathrooms were too tiny for 2 people to fit into, and the carpets were the type that you are afraid to take your shoes off.
reviews.title: Close to the airport and light rail

reviews.text: I must say the beds were comfortable, but sooo uninviting to look at. Guys, is it all Holiday Inns that are this run down, or just this particular one. Got it from a priceline deal of 59. It was barely worth that price. The posted rate was 259. Is that for real?
reviews.title: Awfull!!! GO ELSEWHERE

reviews.text: The was my first stay at the Holiday Inn, and I was pleasantly surprised. Some of the reviews I had read did not give me much hope after I won this room on priceline.com. I was in town to watch a Mariners game, and tried to get a hotel in downtown Seattle for around $100 on priceline.com, which on Labor Day weekend was an impossibility. I have recently been staying at hotels near the airport and taking the light rail back and forth to the games. While it takes about 35 minutes to travel there from the airport station, the price difference in hotel and parking rates makes the ride worth the savings.
reviews.title: Treated well

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful when I checked in. I actually parked my car here at about 10 AM, went to the game, and then checked in at about 6:30 PM. No hassles.
reviews.title: About what you'd expect

aka: Holiday Inn Seattle - Seatac International Airport Hotel Seatac
description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Seattle Airport Hotel. We are located opposite of the terminals of Seattle International Airport, only 20 minutes from downtown Seattle, Pike Place Market, Safeco Field and Century Link Field, the world-famous Space Needle as well as other unique Pacific Northwest attractions. Boeing's Museum of Flight is just 5 miles away (free public shuttle available). Town Car service available at taxi cab prices exclusively for overnight guests. Free wireless high-speed Internet access in all rooms. Complimentary 24-hour Seattle Airport shuttle. Parking available for $16/night. Dine at Seven Hills Grille, featuring Pacific Northwest cuisine or order room service. We also feature a 24-hour health club/workout room. Visit our fully-equipped, self-service 24-hour business center.
